account_id.description: The Harness account id. This can also be set using the `HARNESS_ACCOUNT_ID` environment variable.

api_key.description: The Harness API key. This can also be set using the `HARNESS_API_KEY` environment variable.

endpoint.description: The URL of the Harness API endpoint. The default is `https://app.harness.io`. This can also be set using the `HARNESS_ENDPOINT` environment variable.

ng_api_key.description: The Harness nextgen API key. This can also be set using the `HARNESS_NG_API_KEY` environment variable.

ng_endpoint.description: The URL of the Harness nextgen API. The default is `https://app.harness.io/gateway/ng/api`. This can also be set using the `HARNESS_NG_ENDPOINT` environment variable.

block.description: Resource for creating a raw YAML configuration in Harness. Note: This works for all objects EXCEPT application objects. This resource uses the config-as-code API's. When updating the `name` or `path` of this resource you should typically also set the `create_before_destroy = true` lifecycle setting.

is_manual_trigger_authorized.description: When this is set to true, all manual triggers will require API Key authorization

branch.description: The specified branch of the connector.

connectivity_statuses.description: The connectivity status of the connector. Available options are SUCCESS, FAILURE, PARTIAL, UNKNOWN

first_result.description: When set to true if the query returns more than one result the first item will be selected. When set to false (default) this will return an error.

get_default_from_other_repo.description: Whether to get default from other repo.

get_distinct_from_branches.description: Whether to get distinct from branches.

include_all_connectors_available_at_scop.description: Whether to include all connectors available at scope.

inheriting_credentials_from_delegate.description: Whether the connector inherits credentials from the delegate.

search_term.description: The search term used to find the connector.

type.description: The type of the selected connector.

types.description: The type of the connector. Available values are K8sCluster, Git, Splunk, AppDynamics, Prometheus, Dynatrace, Vault, AzureKeyVault, DockerRegistry, Local, AwsKms, GcpKms, AwsSecretManager, Gcp, Aws, Artifactory, Jira, Nexus, Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket, Codecommit, CEAws, CEAzure, GcpCloudCost, CEK8sCluster, HttpHelmRepo, NewRelic, Datadog, SumoLogic, PagerDuty

features_enabled.description: The CCM features that are enabled. Valid options are BILLING, OPTIMIZATION, VISIBILITY.
